Thus have I heard. Once, the Buddha was in the palace of the SÄgara dragon, together with eight thousand great

At that time, the World-Honored One said to the dragon king:
Because the thoughts of all sentient beings are different, their actions are also different. Because of this, there is the revolving of the various destinies.
Dragon King!
Do you see that in this assembly and in the great ocean, the shapes and kinds are each different?
In this way, all of them are caused by the good and evil bodily actions, verbal actions, and mental actions created by the mind.
But the mind has no form and cannot be grasped. It is merely the gathering and arising of false dharmas, ultimately without an owner, without a self or anything belonging to a self.
Although each appears differently according to their karma, in reality there is no doer in them.
Therefore, all dharmas are inconceivable, their intrinsic nature is like an illusion.
The wise, knowing this, should cultivate good karma, for the aggregates, sense bases, and elements produced thereby will all be upright and pleasing to behold.
Dragon King!

You should observe the Buddha's body, born from hundreds of thousands of myriads of merits and virtues, adorned with the major and minor marks, its radiance illuminating and outshining the great assembly;
even countless myriads of self-existent Brahma kings would no longer appear.
Those who gaze upon the TathÄgata's body will all be dazzled!
You should also observe these great bodhisattvas, their sublime forms being pure and adorned, all born from the cultivation of good karma and merit.

Now, the sentient beings in the great ocean, with various appearances, large and small, are all due to their own minds giving rise to various thoughts, creating unwholesome actions of body, speech, and mind. Therefore, they each receive their own retribution according to their karma.
You should now cultivate and study in this way, and also enable sentient beings to understand cause and effect and cultivate wholesome karma.
You should remain unshakable in this right view, and do not fall into the views of annihilationism or eternalism again. Respectfully serve and make offerings to the fields of merit!
Therefore, you will also receive the respect and offerings of humans and gods.
Dragon King!
You should know that there is one Dharma that bodhisattvas can use to end all the sufferings of the evil paths.
What is that one?

It means that day and night, always thinking, contemplating, and observing wholesome dharmas, causing the wholesome dharmas to increase moment by moment, not allowing even a trace of unwholesomeness to mix in.
This can cause all evils to be permanently severed and wholesome dharmas to be perfected, and one will always be able to draw near to the buddhas, bodhisattvas, and other holy assemblies.

As for wholesome dharmas, they refer to the bodies of humans and gods, the enlightenment of Å›rÄvakas, the enlightenment of pratyekabuddhas, and unsurpassed enlightenment. All of these are accomplished based on this dharma as their foundation, and are therefore called wholesome dharmas.
This dharma is precisely the ten wholesome courses of action.
What are the ten?
They refer to being able to permanently abstain from killing, stealing, sexual misconduct, false speech, divisive speech, harsh speech, frivolous speech, greed, hatred, and wrong views.
Dragon King!
If one abstains from killing, one will be able to accomplish ten dharmas of freedom from vexation.
What are the ten?
First, universally bestowing fearlessness upon all beings;
Second, always giving rise to a greatly compassionate mind towards all beings;
Third, permanently severing all habitual tendencies of anger;
Fourth, the body is always free from illness;
Fifth, having a long lifespan;
Sixth, always being guarded by non-human beings;
Seventh, always being free from nightmares and sleeping and waking happily;
Eighth, eliminating enmity and resentment, with many grudges naturally resolved;
Ninth, being free from the fear of evil paths;
Tenth, being reborn in the heavens upon death.
These are the ten. If one can dedicate them towards supreme, perfect enlightenment, then upon attaining Buddhahood, one will obtain the Buddha's freedom of mind and longevity.
Furthermore, Dragon King!
If one abstains from stealing, one will attain ten trustworthy dharmas.
What are the ten?
First, one's wealth will accumulate, and it cannot be dispersed or destroyed by kings, thieves, water, fire, or unloved children;
Second, many people will love and cherish one;
Third, people will not deceive or exploit one;
Fourth, one will be praised in the ten directions;
Fifth, one will not worry about harm;
Sixth, one's good reputation will spread far and wide;
Seventh, one will be fearless in assemblies;
eighth, wealth, life, complexion, strength, comfort, and eloquence are all complete and without deficiency;
ninth, always harboring a generous mind;
tenth, after death, one is reborn in the heavens.
These are the ten. If one can dedicate them to supreme, perfect enlightenment, then upon becoming a Buddha in the future, one will attain the pure great wisdom of enlightenment.
Furthermore, Dragon King!
If one abstains from sexual misconduct, one will attain four kinds of wisdom-praised dharmas.
What are the four?
First, the faculties are well-tamed;
second, one is forever free from agitation;
third, one is praised by the world;
fourth, one's spouse cannot be harmed.
These are the four. If one can dedicate them to supreme, perfect enlightenment, then upon becoming a Buddha in the future, one will attain the hidden male organ of a Buddha.
Furthermore, Dragon King!
If one abstains from false speech, one will attain eight kinds of heaven-praised dharmas.
What are the eight?
First, their mouths are always pure and fragrant like blue lotus flowers;
Second, they are trusted and respected by all in the world;
Third, their words are authoritative, and humans and gods revere and love them;
Fourth, they always comfort sentient beings with loving words;
Fifth, they attain the supreme intention and their three karmas are pure;
Sixth, their words are without error and their minds are always joyful;
Seventh, their words are respected and followed by humans and gods;
Eighth, their wisdom is exceptional and none can subdue them.
These are the eight. If one can dedicate them to supreme, perfect enlightenment, then upon becoming a Buddha, one will attain the TathÄgata's true speech.
Furthermore, O Dragon King!
If one abandons divisive speech, one will attain five kinds of indestructible dharmas.
What are the five?ğŸ”½First, one attains an indestructible body because none can harm it;
Second, one attains indestructible retinue because none can break it;
Third, they attain unshakable faith, in accordance with their fundamental karma;
Fourth, they attain unshakable Dharma practice, because their cultivation is firm;
Fifth, they attain unshakable good spiritual friends, because they are not deceived.

These are the five. If one can dedicate them to supreme, perfect enlightenment, then when one attains Buddhahood in the future, one will have a true retinue, and the mÄras and non-Buddhists will not be able to disturb it.
Furthermore, Dragon King!
If one abstains from harsh speech, one will be able to accomplish eight kinds of pure karma.
What are the eight?
First, one's words are not out of proportion;
Second, one's words are all beneficial;
Third, one's words must accord with principle;
Fourth, one's words are beautiful and wonderful;
Fifth, one's words can be accepted;
Sixth, one's words are trustworthy;
Seventh, one's words are beyond reproach;
Eighth, one's words are all delightful.
These are the eight. If one can dedicate them to supreme, perfect enlightenment, then upon becoming a Buddha in the future, one will be endowed with the TathÄgata's Brahma-like voice.
Furthermore, Dragon King!
If one abstains from frivolous speech, one will attain three kinds of certainty.
What are the three?
First, one will certainly be loved by the wise;
second, one will certainly be able to answer questions truthfully with wisdom;
third, one will certainly have the most supreme majestic virtue among humans and gods, without falsehood.

These are the three. If one can dedicate them to supreme, perfect enlightenment, then upon becoming a Buddha in the future, one will attain the TathÄgata's predictions, all of which will not be in vain.
Furthermore, Dragon King!
If one abstains from covetousness, one will attain five kinds of mastery.
What are the five?
First, one has mastery over one's three karmas because one's faculties are complete;
Second, mastery over wealth, because all enemies and thieves cannot steal it;
Third, mastery over blessings and virtues, because all things are fully provided according to one's wishes;
Fourth, mastery over the royal position, because all precious and wonderful things are offered;
Fifth, the obtained things are a hundred times more excellent than originally sought, because in the past one was not stingy or jealous.

These are the five. If one can dedicate them to supreme, perfect enlightenment, then when one attains Buddhahood in the future, one will be especially revered in the three realms and will be respected and served by all.
Furthermore, Dragon King!
If one is free from anger, one will attain eight kinds of joyful mental states.
What are the eight?
First, a mind free from harm;
Second, a mind free from anger;
Third, a mind free from disputes;
Fourth, a mind of gentleness and straightforwardness;
Fifth, attaining the mind of loving-kindness of the sages;
Sixth, always having a mind to benefit and comfort sentient beings;
Seventh, the body is upright and dignified, respected by the masses;
Eighth, due to harmony and patience, one is quickly reborn in the Brahma world.

These are the eight. If one can dedicate them to supreme, perfect enlightenment, then upon becoming a Buddha in the future, one will attain an unobstructed mind, and those who observe it will never tire of it.
Furthermore, Dragon King!
If one abandons wrong views, one will be able to accomplish ten meritorious dharmas.
What are the ten?
First, one attains true wholesome intentions and true wholesome companions;
Second, one deeply believes in cause and effect, and would rather lose one's life than do evil;
Third, one only takes refuge in the Buddha, not in other gods;
Fourth, with a sincere mind and right views, one forever leaves behind all auspicious and inauspicious doubts and entanglements;
Fifth, one is always reborn among humans and gods, never again in the evil paths;
Sixth, immeasurable blessings and wisdom increase more and more;
Seventh, one forever leaves behind wrong paths and practices the noble path;
Eighth, not giving rise to the view of a self, abandoning all evil karma;
Ninth, abiding in unobstructed views, tenth, not falling into difficulties.

These are the ten. If one can dedicate them to supreme, perfect enlightenment, then when one attains Buddhahood in the future, one will quickly realize all Buddha-dharmas and accomplish mastery of spiritual powers.
At that time the World-Honored One further told the Dragon King:

If there are bodhisattvas who rely on this good karma, when cultivating the path, they can avoid killing and practice giving. Therefore, they will always be wealthy, with possessions that cannot be taken away;
They will have a long life without untimely death, and will not be harmed by any enemies or thieves.
Avoiding stealing and practicing giving, they will always be wealthy, with possessions that cannot be taken away;
They will be supreme and incomparable, and will be able to fully gather the Buddha's Dharma treasury.
Avoiding sexual misconduct and practicing giving, they will always be wealthy, with possessions that cannot be taken away;
The family was upright, and neither his mother nor his wife and children had any desire to look at him with lustful thoughts.
Because of giving while abstaining from false speech, he was always wealthy with inexhaustible treasures, and no one could encroach upon or steal them;
he was free from slander, embraced the true Dharma, and accomplished his vows as he had sworn.
Because of giving while abstaining from divisive speech, he was always wealthy with inexhaustible treasures, and no one could encroach upon or steal them;
his retinue was harmonious, with the same aspirations, and they were always free from discord.
Because of giving while abstaining from harsh speech, he was always wealthy with inexhaustible treasures, and no one could encroach upon or steal them;
all the assemblies joyfully took refuge in him, and everyone believed and accepted his words without any opposition.
Because of giving while abstaining from meaningless speech, he was always wealthy with inexhaustible treasures, and no one could encroach upon or steal them;
his words were not in vain, and everyone respected and accepted them. He was able to skillfully resolve all doubts and uncertainties.
Because of giving while abstaining from covetousness, he was always wealthy with inexhaustible treasures, and no one could encroach upon or steal them;
All that they possess, they give away with wisdom, their faith and understanding firm, endowed with great power.
Because they practice giving with a mind free from anger, they are always wealthy, with treasures that cannot be taken away;
they quickly accomplish unobstructed mental wisdom, their faculties well-developed, seen with respect and affection by all.
Because they practice giving with a mind free from wrong views, they are always wealthy, with treasures that cannot be taken away;

they are always born in a family with right views and faith, where they see the Buddha, hear the Dharma, and make offerings to the Saá¹…gha, never forgetting or losing the great mind of enlightenment.
This is how the great being, when practicing the bodhisattva path, practices the ten wholesome actions, adorns them with giving, and attains such great benefits.
Dragon King!

To summarize, because they practice the ten wholesome paths and adorn them with precepts, they are able to give rise to all the meanings and benefits of the Buddha's teachings and fulfill their great vows;
because they adorn themselves with patience, they attain the Buddha's perfect voice and are endowed with the marks and characteristics;
Because of the adornment of diligence, one can destroy the mÄras and enter the Buddha's Dharma treasury;
Because of the adornment of concentration, one can give rise to mindfulness, wisdom, a sense of shame, a sense of integrity, and lightness and ease;
Because of the adornment of wisdom, one can sever all discriminating false views;
Because of the adornment of loving-kindness, one does not give rise to harm towards any sentient beings;
Because of the adornment of compassion, one pities all sentient beings and never abandons them;
Because of the adornment of joy, one sees those who cultivate goodness without harboring resentment or jealousy;
Because of the adornment of equanimity, one has no feelings of love or hatred towards favorable or unfavorable objects;
Because of the adornment of the four means of attraction, one always diligently attracts and transforms all sentient beings;
Because of the adornment of the four establishments of mindfulness, one is well able to cultivate the contemplation of the four establishments of mindfulness;
Because of the adornment of the four right efforts, one is able to completely eliminate all unwholesome dharmas and accomplish all wholesome dharmas;
Because of the adornment of the bases of spiritual power, one always causes body and mind to be light, at ease, and blissful;

Because of the adornment of the five faculties, one has deep faith and firm resolve, diligently practices without slacking off, is always free from confusion and forgetfulness, is tranquil and well-controlled, and cuts off all afflictions.
Because of the adornment of the powers, all enemies are completely destroyed and none can harm one.
Because of the adornment of the factors of enlightenment, one always skillfully awakens to all dharmas.
Because of the adornment of the right path, one attains right wisdom that is always present.
Because of the adornment of tranquility, one is able to completely wash away all bonds and afflictions.
Because of the adornment of contemplation, one is able to know the intrinsic nature of dharmas as they truly are.
Because of the adornment of skillful means, one quickly attains the fulfillment of conditioned and unconditioned happiness.
Dragon King!
You should know that these ten wholesome actions, up to and including the ten powers, the fearlessnesses, and the eighteen distinctive abilities of the Buddha, all attain complete fulfillment.
Therefore, you should diligently cultivate and study!
Dragon King!
It is just as all cities and towns are able to be securely established by relying on the great earth;
All medicinal herbs, grasses, shrubs, and forests also rely on the earth to grow.

These ten wholesome courses of action are also like this. All humans and gods rely on them to establish themselves. All the enlightenments of Å›rÄvakas and pratyekabuddhas, the practices of bodhisattvas, and all the teachings of the Buddhas are all accomplished together by relying on this great earth of the ten wholesome courses of action.
